Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know a lot of us have been feeling under the weather lately. It's that time of year. And according to a study done by the University of Arizona, they've discovered that your keyboards have hundreds of times more bacteria, per square inch, than a toilet seat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's true, that's true. I dated her momma, and you know what-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [under his breath] Um... kay. Uh, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: One of the simplest ways to cut down on the spread of germs is to use something called the vampire cough.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Di-Did you say vampire?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no, it's just that if a vampire had to cough, he would do it like this. [coughs into elbow]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, other things you can do to help cut down on the spread of disease are to wash your hands regularly. Don't come in if you're sick.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [rolls his eyes and shakes his head] Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And get your flu shot. Also, I'm going to set up hand sanitizing stations around the office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: NO, no, no. They will cost you your life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Elaborate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The worst thing you can do for your immune system is to coddle it. They need to fight their own battles. If Sabre really cared about our well-being, they would set up hand de-sanitizing stations. A simple bowl at every juncture filled with dirt, vomit, fecal matter...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not - I'm not going to do that. I'm not going to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exposing yourself to germs is the best way to make yourself stronger.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So by that rationale, if I had to sneeze, I should just sneeze on you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. I would welcome it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sneezes on Dwight, looks at camera] You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The principle is sound. To avoid illness, expose yourself to germs, enabling your immune system to develop antibodies. I don't know why everyone doesn't do this. Maybe they have something against living forever.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Jim. Pam. [gasps, speaks in baby voice] And the precious bundle of God's gift to everything. [back to her normal voice] I wish you both a pleasant day. [baby voice] And you too. Yes. Praise God. Ok.

Quote.Text: Cece's getting christened today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Big day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Everyone from work is here. We weren't planning on that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Top of the Sunday morning to you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And a top of the day to you too, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hope you brought your pipes. We're about to smoke the opium of the masses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yes. [mimicking smoking] Doobie-doobie doo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [looking at Cece, under his breath] Ah, man. [looks at Erin talking to Gabe]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does the Nard-dog want Nard-pups? Yeah. I want a big ol' litter of Nard-pups. All jumping around, sucking on the teet. Put 'em in a box, give 'em to my neighbors. Yeah, I want kids.

Quote.Text: [handing out cards] For all your paper and printer needs. For all your paper and printer needs. For all your paper and printer needs.

Quote.Text: Oh, Michael, this is just for family.

Quote.Speaker: Michael

Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Michael. I need you to say it. I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [normal voice] I'm not the godfather.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears his throat] So who is the godfather?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Our friend, Seth, and his wife there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Old friend, like, you've known him since kindergarten?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I met his wife in Mommy and Me. They're a great couple. You should meet them later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I have plenty of friends, so... all right, well, you have great seats. Enjoy the show.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Thank you for coming, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael

Quote.Speaker: Pastor
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good morning.

They say that the middle class is disappearing, and with it, the soul of America. So, as a gift to this beautiful congregation, I would like to offer a 4% discount on all Dunder Mifflin Sabre products if you buy a printer at full price.

Quote.Text: Right now?

Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Text: Honey, no.

Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Text: This is happening.

Quote.Text: You said you checked it.

Quote.Text: Opus dei.

Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? Stop it.

Quote.Text: I'll call you back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Text: I didn't get one.

Quote.Text: Who the heck was that?

Quote.Text: If you'll have me, yes.

Quote.Text: Heck, yes.

Quote.Text: Gah!
